content: The project proposal should outline your intended deep learning project, providing a clear roadmap of your approach and goals.

sections.name: Word Limit
sections.description: Maximum of 500 words. Be concise and to the point while covering all necessary details.

sections.name: Project Title
sections.description: A clear, concise title reflecting the project's focus. Ensure the title is descriptive and gives an immediate understanding of the projectâ€™s aim.

sections.name: Objectives
sections.description: Clearly state the goals of the project. What problem will you solve, and what are the expected outcomes? Make sure the objectives are realistic and measurable.

sections.name: Methodology
sections.description: Provide a brief overview of the proposed deep learning approach. Describe the model(s) you plan to use, any data sources, and the techniques you will apply. Make sure the methodology is well-suited to solving the problem you've identified.

sections.name: Significance
sections.description: Explain the significance of your project. Why is it important, and what impact could it have? Include any potential real-world applications or advancements your work could contribute to.

sections.name: Challenges and Limitations
sections.description: Identify potential challenges you may face, such as data quality, model limitations, or computational resources. Acknowledge these challenges and propose possible solutions or approaches to mitigate them.

problem_and_solution_selection.content: Students are free to choose any real-world problem that they think can be solved using deep learning techniques. Below are some example problems and types of solutions that can be selected for the project.

examples_of_problems.description: Predict future values of a sequence of data points based on historical observations. Common in fields like finance, economics, weather, and energy consumption.
Train deep learning models to recognize objects, people, scenes, and activities in images and videos.
Train models to transcribe speech to text, recognize spoken language, and perform speaker identification.
Analyze and understand human language for tasks like sentiment analysis, machine translation, and text classification.
Use deep learning models to recommend products, movies, music, etc., based on user preferences and behavior.
Identify suspicious patterns in financial transactions and help detect fraud.
Analyze medical images, predict patient outcomes, and aid in drug discovery using deep learning models.
Process data from cameras, lidar sensors, and other sources to enable autonomous driving.

solution_selection.content: Students are free to choose the type of deep learning architecture they want to implement. Below are some common types of deep learning architectures:

architectures.name: Feedforward Neural Networks (FNNs)
architectures.description: Simple architecture where data flows in one direction from input to output, used for tasks like regression and classification.

architectures.name: Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs)
architectures.description: Designed to process sequential data, such as time series or text. Capable of handling variable-length data and maintaining context.

architectures.name: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)
architectures.description: Used for image recognition and processing tasks. Effective at analyzing spatial data like images and videos by learning local patterns.

architectures.name: Deep Belief Networks (DBNs)
architectures.description: Generative deep learning architecture used for unsupervised learning, learning complex data distributions, and generating new data samples.

architectures.name: Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)
architectures.description: Involves two networks, a generator and a discriminator, that compete to generate synthetic data and evaluate its authenticity.

architectures.name: Autoencoders
architectures.description: Unsupervised learning architecture used to compress data into a lower-dimensional representation and reconstruct it back to its original form.

solution_selection.note: The choice of architecture depends on the type of problem and the data being processed. Combining multiple architectures can lead to more powerful models.
